channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Kisses yes, Bezos No,' protesters say, as Bezos wedding stirs controversy in Venice
item.description: Protesters denounced the three-day celebrations for the wedding between Jeff Bezos and his wife Lauren Sanchez Bezos as a symbol of rising inequality ...

item.title: Senate Takes Up Trump’s Policy Bill, as G.O.P. Scrounges for Votes to Pass It
item.description: Republican leaders barely scaled a key procedural hurdle to bring up the bill, but Democrats delayed its consideration and it was unclear whether the ...

item.title: Why a G.O.P. Medicaid Requirement Could Set States Up for Failure
item.description: The Republicans’ big bill would require most states to build technology systems quickly and with little funding.

item.title: How Europe Got Tough on Migration
item.description: The European Union has not gone as far as President Trump in cracking down on immigration, but its shift is already profound.

item.title: Mikayla Raines, Who Rescued Foxes and Other Animals, Is Dead at 30
item.description: She founded Save a Fox Rescue to care for foxes that had been abandoned or bred for their pelts on fur farms. She gained millions of social media foll...

item.title: How Europe Got Tough on Migration
item.description: The European Union has not gone as far as President Trump in cracking down on immigration, but its shift is already profound.

item.title: America Can’t Do to North Korea What It Just Did to Iran
item.description: The Trump administration should embrace a North Korea strategy that aims to contain escalation, not keep a white-knuckled grip on a failed policy.

item.title: Around 100,000 march in Budapest Pride event in defiance of Hungary's ban
item.description: Marchers gambled with potential police intervention and fines to participate in the annual Budapest Pride, which was outlawed by a law passed by Prime...

item.title: Man kicked and injured a CBP beagle during airport baggage search
item.description: An Egyptian traveler who kicked the 25-pound dog was ordered to pay its vet fees and turn himself in for removal from the country.

item.title: J.M. Smucker plans to remove artificial colors from its jams and other products
item.description: Smucker joins a growing number of big food companies that have announced plans to eliminate artificial dyes.

item.title: Authors petition publishers to curtail their use of AI
item.description: The open letter and accompanying petition asking publishers "to make a pledge that they will never release books that were created by machines" garner...

item.title: Takeaways From a Times Investigation of the Pope’s Legacy on Sex Abuse
item.description: As a bishop in Peru, Pope Leo XIV’s handling of two abuse cases was a study in contrasts, siding strongly with victims in one and accused of failing t...

item.title: French Police Officers Who Beat a Black Man on Camera to Stand Trial
item.description: The brutal beating in 2020 of Michel Zecler, a well-known music producer, sent shock waves through France.

item.title: Budapest Pride Parade Was Bigger Than Ever, Despite Orban’s Ban
item.description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s party enacted the ban, but Budapest’s mayor allowed the event to go on. The police sat on the sidelines.

item.title: At Bezos’ Venetian Wedding: Buzz, Bling and Backlash
item.description: The over-the-top party in the photogenic Italian city mixed Hollywood, Silicon Valley and political overtones.
